00076 void define_aptceltransformer_options(PgOptions* opts)
00077 {
00078   opts->setUsage("apt-data-step - Trying out chipstream stages\n");
00079 
00080   opts->defineOption("h", "help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00081                      "This message.",
00082                      "false");
00083   opts->defineOption("v", "verbose", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00084                      "How verbose to be with status messages 0 - quiet, 1 - usual messages, 2 - more messages.",
00085                      "1");
00086   opts->defineOption("", "target-sketch", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00087                      "File specifying a target distribution to use for quantile normalization.",
00088                      "");
00089   opts->defineOption("", "a5-target-sketch", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00090                      "File specifying an target distribution to use for quantile normalization in A5 format.",
00091                      "");
00092   opts->defineOption("c", "chipstream", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00093                      "String representing tranformation desired. "
00094                      "For example: 'quant-norm.sketch=50000' does a quantile normalization using 50000 points.",
00095                      "");
00096   opts->defineOption("", "probe-norm-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00097                      "File specifying index of probes (1 based) to use for normalization.",
00098                      "");
00099   opts->defineOption("d", "cdf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00100                      "File defining probe sets",
00101                      "");
00102   opts->defineOption("", "clf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00103                      "File defining probes",
00104                      "");
00105   opts->defineOption("", "kill-list", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00106                      "File defining probes to remove",
00107                      "");
00108   opts->defineOption("", "pgf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00109                      "File defining probe sets",
00110                      "");
00111   opts->defineOption("", "spf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00112                      "File defining probe sets",
00113                      "");
00114   opts->defineOption("", "write-sketch", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00115                      "Write the quantile normalization distribution (or sketch) "
00116                      "to a file in output-dir for reuse with target-sketch option.",
00117                      "false");
00118   opts->defineOption("", "a5-write-sketch", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00119                      "Write the quantile normalization distribution (or sketch) "
00120                      "to a file in output-dir for reuse with target-sketch option.",
00121                      "false");
00122   opts->defineOption("", "force", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00123                      "Disable chip type checks.",
00124                      "false");
00125   opts->defineOption("o", "out-dir", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00126                      "Directory to write result files into.",
00127                      ".");
00128   opts->defineOption("","temp-dir", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00129                      "Directory for temporary files when working off disk. Using network mounted drives is not advised. When not set, the output folder will be used.",
00130                      "");
00131   opts->defineOption("", "input-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00132                      "Input data store file.",
00133                      "");
00134   opts->defineOption("", "output-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00135                      "Output data store file.",
00136                      "");
00137   opts->defineOption("", "version", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00138                      "Display version information.",
00139                      "false");
00140 }

00142 /** 
00143  * Figure out chip dimensions from the cel file specified.
00144  * 
00145  * @param fileName - Name of cel file to read header from.
00146  * @param numCols - Number of x columns.
00147  * @param numRows - Number of y rows.
00148  */
00149 void getDimensions(string fileName, colrow_t& numCols, colrow_t& numRows) {
00150   affxcel::CCELFileData cel;
00151   cel.SetFileName(fileName.c_str());
00152   if(!cel.ReadHeader()) 
00153     Err::errAbort("Can't read cel file: " + cel.GetFileName());
00154   numCols = cel.GetCols();
00155   numRows = cel.GetRows();
00156   cel.Close();
00157 }
00158

00160 
00161 /** 
00162  * Transform all of the cel files specified using the chipstream modification stream
00163  * specified by the chipStreamStr and save the new modified cel files in the output directory.
00164  */
00165 void transformCels(AptCelTransformerOptions &o) {
00166   /* get basic layout info */
00167   colrow_t numCols, numRows;
00168   int probeCount, psCount;
00169   vector<string> chipTypes;
00170 
00171   if(o.cdfFile != "") {
00172       EngineUtil::getCdfChipType(chipTypes, numRows, numCols, probeCount, psCount, o.cdfFile);
00173   }else if(o.pgfFile != "") {
00174       EngineUtil::getPgfChipType(chipTypes, numRows, numCols, probeCount, o.pgfFile, o.clfFile);
00175   }else if(o.spfFile != "") {
00176       EngineUtil::getSpfChipType(chipTypes, numRows, numCols, probeCount, psCount, o.spfFile);
00177   }
00178 
00179   /* Get the layout for the chip. */
00180   // Specifies probesets, locations of features on chip.
00181   ChipLayout layout; 
00182   // empty list of probesets, ie we want to load all
00183   std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr> probeSetsToLoad; 
00184   // empty list, ie load everything
00185   std::vector<bool> probeSubset; 
00186   // we have already check chip type, so use empty string;
00187   string chipType; 
00188   //
00189   probeidmap_t killList;
00190 
00191   if(o.cdfFile != "") {
00192     Verbose::out(1, "Opening cdf file: " + Fs::basename(o.cdfFile));
00193     if(!layout.openCdf(o.cdfFile, probeSetsToLoad, NULL, probeSubset, chipType, killList, false)) 
00194         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open cdf file: " + o.cdfFile);
00195   }else if(o.pgfFile != "") {
00196     affx::ClfFile clf;
00197 
00198     /* open clf file. */
00199     if(o.clfFile=="") 
00200         Err::errAbort("Must specify a clf file for chip.");
00201     Verbose::out(1, "Opening clf file: " +  Fs::basename(o.clfFile));
00202     if(!clf.open(o.clfFile))
00203         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open clf file: " + o.clfFile);
00204     layout.setDimensions(clf.getXMax() + 1, clf.getYMax() + 1);
00205     
00206     /* Make sure our assumptions about CLF file are true */
00207     Err::check(clf.getSequential() == 1,
00208                 "ProbesetSummarizeEngine::loadPgfLayout() - unable to handle clf file without sequential set to 1.");
00209     Err::check(clf.getOrder().compare("col_major") == 0 || clf.getOrder().compare("row_major") == 0,
00210                "Unable to handle clf file without order set to row_major (old mislabeled 'col_major' accepted due to earlier bug.)");
00211    
00212     /* open pgf */
00213     Verbose::out(1, "Opening pgf file: " + Fs::basename(o.pgfFile));
00214     if(!layout.openPgf(o.pgfFile, clf.getXMax() + 1, clf.getYMax() + 1, probeSetsToLoad, NULL, NULL, probeSubset, chipType, killList, false, false))
00215         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open PGF file: " + o.pgfFile);
00216   }else if(o.spfFile != "") {
00217     std::set<affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType> psTypesToLoad;
00218     Verbose::out(1, "Opening spf file: " + Fs::basename(o.cdfFile));
00219     layout.openSpf(o.spfFile, probeSetsToLoad, NULL, probeSubset, chipType, false, psTypesToLoad);
00220   } else {
00221     Verbose::out(1,"Setting layout dimensions from cel file. Assuming all probes are PM.");
00222     layout.setDimensions(numCols, numRows);
00223     vector<bool> mask(layout.getProbeCount(), true);
00224     layout.setPmProbeMask(mask);
00225   }
00226 
00227   /* get list of probes to kill */
00228   /* we do this after the chip layout load as we don't want these to drop on the floor */
00229   if(o.killListFile != "")
00230     ChipLayout::fillInKillList(o.killListFile, killList, numRows, numCols);
00231 
00232   /* Setup chipstream factory */
00233   ChipStreamFactory cFactory;
00234 
00235   if(o.targetSketch != "") 
00236     cFactory.readTargetSketchFromFile(o.targetSketch);
00237   if(o.m_a5_targetSketch != "") 
00238     cFactory.readTargetSketchFromFile_a5(o.m_a5_targetSketch);
00239   if(o.writeSketch) 
00240     cFactory.setWriteSketchDir(o.outDir);
00241   if(o.m_a5_writeSketch) 
00242     cFactory.setWriteSketchDir_a5(o.outDir);
00243   if(o.probeNormFile != "")
00244     cFactory.readNormProbesFromFile(o.probeNormFile);
00245   if(o.killListFile != "") {
00246     /// @todo allow provision of kill list to Chipstream Factor
00247     ///cFactory.setKillList(killList);
00248     Err::errAbort("Kill list not yet implemented. Try probe-norm-file instead.");
00249   }
00250 
00251   /* Create our chipstream objects. */
00252   std::string chipStreamStr = o.chipstream;
00253   ChipStream *cStream = NULL;      // Our chipstream for transforming data.
00254   string dummy;
00255   cStream = cFactory.chipStreamForString(chipStreamStr, layout, dummy );
00256   ChipStreamDataTransform transform(cStream);
00257   DataStore in;
00258   in.initFromFile(o.f5input);
00259   DataStore out(o.f5output);
00260   out.initFromDataStore(in);
00261   PsBoard board;
00262   transform.transformData(board, in, out);
00263   Verbose::out(1, "Done.");
00264 }
00265 
00266 
00267 void fillInOptions(PgOptions *opts, AptCelTransformerOptions &o) {
00268   o.help = opts->getBool("help");
00269   o.verbose = opts->getInt("verbose");
00270   o.targetSketch = opts->get("target-sketch");
00271   o.chipstream = opts->get("chipstream");
00272   o.probeNormFile = opts->get("probe-norm-file");
00273   o.writeSketch = opts->getBool("write-sketch");
00274   o.m_a5_writeSketch = opts->getBool("a5-write-sketch");
00275   o.force = opts->getBool("force");
00276   o.outDir = opts->get("out-dir");
00277   o.tempDir = opts->get("temp-dir");
00278   if (o.tempDir == "") {
00279     o.tempDir = Fs::join(o.outDir,"temp"); 
00280   }
00281   Util::chompLastIfSep(o.outDir);
00282   o.cdfFile = opts->get("cdf-file");
00283   o.clfFile = opts->get("clf-file");
00284   o.pgfFile = opts->get("pgf-file");
00285   o.spfFile = opts->get("spf-file");
00286   o.killListFile = opts->get("kill-list");
00287   o.f5input = opts->get("input-file");
00288   o.f5output = opts->get("output-file");
00289 
00290   /* Sanity checks... */
00291   if(o.chipstream == "") 
00292     Err::errAbort("Must specify a chipstream transformer.");
00293   if(o.probeNormFile != "" && o.killListFile != "") 
00294     Err::errAbort("Cannot provide a kill list and a probe norm list.");
00295 }
00296 
00297 /** Everbody's favorite function... */
00298 int main(int argc, const char *argv[]) {
00299   try {
00300     const string version = AptVersionInfo::versionToReport();
00301 
00302     AptCelTransformerOptions ourOpts;
00303     PgOptions *opts = new PgOptions();
00304     define_aptceltransformer_options(opts);
00305     opts->parseArgv(argv);
00306     
00307     if(opts->getBool("help") == true || argc == 1)
00308     {
00309         opts->usage();
00310         cout << "version: " << version << endl;
00311     }
00312     else if(opts->getBool("version"))
00313         cout << "version: " << version << endl;
00314     else {
00315         fillInOptions(opts, ourOpts);
00316         transformCels(ourOpts);
00317     }
00318     
00319     //
00320     delete opts;
00321     
00322     return 0;
00323   } 
00324   catch(...) {
00325       Verbose::out(1,"Unexpected Error: uncaught exception.");
00326       return 1;
00327   }
00328   return 1;
00329 }
